senses.de: Doing something well and quickly without wasting time or energy
senses.ex: She's very efficient at her work.

Tips.title: Workplace Relevance
Tips.description: Used frequently in job descriptions and performance reviews to praise employees.
Tips.example: His efficient nature earned him Employee of the Month.

Tips.title: Time Management
Tips.description: Highlights capability in managing tasks swiftly and prioritizing effectively.
Tips.example: An efficient schedule allows her to finish all assignments on time.

senses.de: Working well and not wasting energy or resources
senses.ex: The car's fuel-efficient engine reduces waste.

Tips.title: Cost Saving
Tips.description: Emphasizes a reduction in expenses by avoiding waste, especially of energy or resources.
Tips.example: Switching to efficient LED bulbs cut our electricity costs.

Tips.title: Environmental Focus
Tips.description: Indicates a beneficial impact on the environment, often linked with 'green' living.
Tips.example: Our company values efficient practices to reduce carbon footprint.

senses.de: Achieving maximum productivity with minimum wasted effort or expense
senses.ex: An efficient study routine means completing more work in less time.

Tips.title: Academic Performance
Tips.description: Refers to the optimized way of learning or working in educational settings.
Tips.example: Her efficient note-taking strategy improved her grades.

Tips.title: Maximized Output
Tips.description: Often associated with achieving goals with the least amount of wasted energy or resources.
Tips.example: Their efficient methods resulted in a record number of sales.

senses.de: Preventing the wasteful use of a particular resource
senses.ex: Efficient use of water can help save the planet.

Tips.title: Resource Allocation
Tips.description: Illustrates the idea of using resources such as water or energy responsibly.
Tips.example: Efficient irrigation systems are essential in arid regions.

Tips.title: Conservation Efforts
Tips.description: Connected with strategies aimed at preserving natural resources.
Tips.example: Efficient waste management is critical for sustainable cities.

Capable.wordDefinition:
Capable refers to having the ability or skill to do something. It means that a person has the necessary qualities or expertise to perform a task, but it does not necessarily imply that they will do it quickly or with minimal effort.

Capable means having the ability to do something, whereas efficient means doing something in the most effective and proficient way possible.

Both words are applicable in different contexts, depending on the situation and task at hand. For example, a person may be capable of solving a complex math problem but not necessarily efficient at doing it quickly.

Competent.wordDefinition:
Competent means having the necessary skills and abilities to do a task or job well. An example of a competent person is someone who is knowledgeable and experienced in their field and is able to perform their duties with a certain level of expertise.

A competent person has the necessary skills and abilities to perform their job well, while an efficient person focuses on completing a task quickly with the least amount of effort, time or resources.

It is possible to be both competent and efficient but sometimes one may be prioritized over the other based on the situation at hand.

Economical.wordDefinition:
Economical refers to being careful with money or resources, while efficient refers to doing a task in the most optimal way possible with the least amount of waste.

For example, if you wanted to save money on gas for your car, you would look for an economical vehicle that has good gas mileage.

Overall, both words are important in different contexts. Being economical is important when it comes to saving resources, while being efficient is important when it comes to saving time and effort.

Effective.wordDefinition:
Effective means "producing the intended result" or "capable of achieving a desired goal." It refers to how well something works in achieving a specific goal or objective.

For example, a new teaching method might be effective in helping students learn a particular subject.

In simple terms, effectiveness is about achieving a goal, while efficiency is about achieving that goal in the best way possible.

If you want to get something done, you need to be effective to achieve your goals, but if you want to get it done quickly and with minimal effort or resources, you need to be efficient.

Expedient.wordDefinition:
Expedient means doing something that is convenient or practical in achieving a particular result, without necessarily considering if it is the best way to do it.

Efficient is more applicable in situations that require a systematic approach that ultimately makes use of the least possible time, resources and energy to achieve the required results, while expedient is more applicable in situations that require quick solutions, particularly when time and resources are limited.

Productive.wordDefinition:
Efficient and productive are both positive adjectives used to describe how well something is done, but they have slightly different meanings.

Productive means achieving or producing a lot of something. For example, if you write a lot of essays in a short amount of time, you are being productive.

Efficient is about doing things in a smart way that saves time and resources, while productive is about achieving a lot of output.

However, if you're a writer, it's more important to be productive so that you can produce a lot of quality writing in a short amount of time.

Proficient.wordDefinition:
Proficient means being skilled or competent at something. It refers to a person's ability to perform a task with a high level of accuracy and expertise.

For instance, a skilled basketball player who can consistently score points and make good passes would be considered proficient.

While efficient focuses on the effectiveness of the process, proficient is more focused on the agility of the individual.

Efficient can be applied to any task, while proficient is more suitable for tasks that require skill, expertise, or accuracy.

Resourceful.wordDefinition:
Resourceful means finding clever and creative solutions to problems using the resources available. It is applicable when you need to come up with innovative solutions in situations where resources are scarce or limited.

In simpler terms, being efficient means doing things quickly and well, while being resourceful means using your creativity to find solutions when resources are limited.

Skilful.wordDefinition:
Efficient means being able to achieve a task with the least amount of effort, time and resources possible. Skilful refers to the ability to perform a task with a high degree of proficiency and expertise.

Skillfulness on the other hand is all about technical know-how and proficiency in performing a task effectively. This is mostly applicable in domains where creativity, artistic expression and mastery are key factors, such as music, art, writing, and sports.

quotes.Text: Every time I travel, I'm in a rage until I reach my destination. I find myself shouting at suitcases, as if it's their fault that I'm an inefficient packer. I've also learnt that whenever you despair of humanity and start thinking that you hate people - as I frequently do - you only have to travel to realise that people are basically all right.
quotes.Title: British Comedian
quotes.Name: Greg Davies

quotes.Text: I was having multiple surgeries after fights and not really addressing them the way I should have and having a proper off-season. So it was leading to more injuries and really making a strong influence on the way I was fighting. I was having to fight around injuries and not fight because it was the most efficient technique to use.
quotes.Title: American Mixed Martial Artist
quotes.Name: Frank Mir

quotes.Text: Subsidising inefficient businesses does not encourage them to become more competitive and means that extra money has to be taken from tax payers for the same result. Inevitably, this reduces the total size of the economy and lowers living standards.
quotes.Title: English Politician
quotes.Name: Jacob Rees-Mogg

quotes.Text: Cambridge is really understanding and helpful, so that's been good, and it's just a case of trying to get stuff done when I am there and just being efficient with managing my time.

quotes.Text: I always thought that using more efficient energy sources, pushing the clean energy technologies such as renewable energies are important.

quotes.Text: When everyone agrees to a single solution and a single plan, there's nothing more efficient in the world than an efficient democracy.

quotes.Text: Poorly paid labor is inefficient labor, the world over.

quotes.Name: Henry George

quotes.Text: Dallas was not a caring city, but it was efficient.

quotes.Name: Lawrence Wright
